summary: The Handgun Permit to Purchase Act (S. 123) proposes a grant program to assist states, local governments, and tribes in developing and improving handgun purchaser licensing programs. The bill authorizes funding for applicants with licensing laws that require background checks, age verification, and regular permit renewal. It highlights findings on gun violence, citing research on the effectiveness of handgun licensing laws in reducing gun-related homicides and suicides. The bill amends the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to establish the grant program.
